title: Part 2
content:
Part 2

WHEN I WOKE up, the stains on the filthy ceiling seemed to sway wildly.

"I've definitely been drinking too much these days…"

I was spacing out, not wanting to get up, when the doorbell rang three times in quick succession.

Realizing the door was unlocked, the visitor came in without hesitation.

Kamogawa, who hadn't been in touch for about two weeks, visited the office, gasping for breath.

"Ayanokouji-san, please wake up! We've found it, the ideal location!"

"…Don't make such a racket."

Paired with my lack of sleep, it felt like he was shouting through a megaphone.

With a ringing in my ears, I reluctantly got up and received the report documents from Kamogawa.

"You have a strong alcohol scent. I'm jealous, where did you go to eat something so delicious?"

"Drinking is part of the job and it's a part of the series of hardships; I don't have the nerves to enjoy it."

If you thought I was just drinking cheap booze and having fun with the girls, you'd be mistaken.

Even as a politician, you couldn't afford to act high and mighty, constantly bowing to superiors and serving drinks. It was no different from the daily life of a salaryman.

The documents Kamogawa excitedly brought were about the property that would serve as the project's stage.

"Saitama, huh? That's your hometown, right?"

I wasn't particularly surprised considering how unrealistic it would be to have it in Tokyo, where things are expensive.

"Yes. Deep in the mountains, there used to be a pharmaceutical company's factory. The company saw a decline in sales decades ago after pollution issues were reported; and a few years ago, they went bankrupt. The factory wasn't demolished and still remains. The size of the property is neither too large nor too small, making it an ideal location for our project."

I placed the documents on the desk and checked the specific location on the computer map.

In this era, being able to access the information I needed in real time from anywhere was truly invaluable.

The ideal location was over an hour from the nearest station and couldn't be reached by bus.

Both the prices for rental and full purchase were listed. Although slightly expensive, it seemed possible to opt for a rental agreement and switch to purchase after a few years.

Well, depending on the negotiations, various terms and amounts could be adjusted.

"However, it seems like they're taking advantage of us with that 2.4 million price, doesn't it? There's a similar place thirty minutes from the station listed at 2.5 million. There seems to be more room for negotiation."

"I think they're just feeling their way at first."

With this location, since it would be hard to find tenants, it wouldn't be difficult to lead them into a position where they want to offer this place without us having to beg for it.

If it's a long-term contract, the other party might agree to a significant price reduction.

"It's a good place, isn't it?"

"You're quite enthusiastic, but what about the budget for renovations?"

"Here it is!"

He took out another document from his bag and handed it to me.

Seems like he at least has the minimum capability to think and put it to use.

All the necessary items for the construction seemed to have been accounted for.

There was even a 3D model created.

"Did you do this?"

"Yes. I asked someone I know in the construction industry. Of course, I haven't mentioned this project at all, so don't worry… What do you think?"

"Not bad. But needless painting and such are completely unnecessary. I have no intention of spending money on making it stylish."

"Thorough budget cuts, then."

"Let's adjust it again in that direction."

First, it was about getting the project on track.

However, results were also required simultaneously.

"Well done for now. I want to contact the owner immediately."

"What about the intermediary? Shall we skip them?"

"No, since we're already involving an intermediary, any petty tricks might backfire. It's better to have them on our side and move forward."

"Understood."

While we needed to keep looking for second and third options, I preferred to settle it in one go. The party with the financial world that Sakayanagi arranged was also approaching.

"If things go smoothly… what about the children? Even if we have the money and facilities, and the educators are ready, it's useless without the children, right?"

Of course, I was also progressing on that front at the same time.

"Don't worry. I have it figured out."

"You've figured it out? Can you be more specific? I'm part of the team, after all."

I glared at Kamogawa, who looked at me with hopeful eyes.

"The world has things better left unknown. If you learn of these things carelessly, I won't be able to help you in an emergency. Not only would I no longer be a politician, but are you prepared to spend years, even decades, in prison?"

"No… I definitely don't want that…!"

It wasn't a threat. In fact, I had started mobilizing a plan that would be instantly doomed if exposed. I couldn't involve Kamogawa in this matter.

It wasn't to protect Kamogawa—it was to protect myself. If this guy were taken by the police, it would be impossible for him to escape rigorous interrogation. Moreover… he wouldn't stay silent either.

"Anyway, there are plenty of ways to secure children, so don't worry."

Normally, when a newborn's parentage couldn't be determined, they'd be sent to a baby home or child welfare facility through the child consultation center. The process would then move to adoption or finding foster parents.

Whether their later lives were happy was unknown, but the only important fact was whether they were provided with a favorable environment. As long as the means to secure newborns were established, there would be no issue with child-rearing institutions getting involved.

"It isn't something I can't tell you, but it would be nice if there were a simpler and easier way to acquire children. But for now, it's still difficult. Even if we proceed by the book, strangers… even if they know we're politicians, won't just hand over children."

"Is that how it is?"

It was true that if you strung together pleasing words, like saying they'd receive generous protection and government favor, the mother might willingly hand over her newborn.

However, the current situation required me to consider cases where this wouldn't occur.

"Can't we also consider taking them from orphanages?"

"There are no orphanages in Japan. To be precise, they're called child welfare facilities. And for newborns and babies like I'm looking for, it would be a baby home, not a child welfare facility. Though, even they would suspect us. It's a matter of life and death."

"…I see."

If you were someone living an ordinary life, it was no surprise to be indifferent to matters like these.

Until today, Kamogawa must've been too busy listing potential facility sites.

"Of course, I intend to approach baby homes too. But that will be after the institution's operations are on track and it has been officially established as a government-led policy."

However, the main plan was to eventually create our own receptacle for children.

We'd either bribe the head of an obstetrics and gynecology clinic or, if that fails, open one.

Finding a doctor willing to sell their soul to the devil wouldn't be that hard.

I explained things to Kamogawa through the computer screen, showing him the detailed plan.

Creating a place that could serve as a receptacle for mothers who couldn't raise their children—this way, no one had any business interfering.

Babies born from the mother's womb would be counted as day zero, and those under twenty-eight days old would be called "newborns." However, we'd secretly take babies up to three months old as well. In exchange for not questioning the mother's responsibility, we'd make a contract stating that they wouldn't be able to interact with their child.

Until they reached six months old, their health would be thoroughly managed. Then, an educational program would be implemented.

"You're preparing to abandon giving the perfect education for the first few years, right?"

"Don't talk nonsense. Whether there's money or not, starting from the first year, we'll provide the children with a thorough education. If you think the political and financial world will be moved with half-baked results, you're naive, Kamogawa."

They also provided elite education to their own children from a young age. Compared to that, if there wasn't a significant difference in ability, the institution's credibility would waver.

We had to develop both academic and physical abilities to their highest levels.

"The more samples, the better. Whether it's one or twenty, we'll accept them all."

No matter how many children broke, if we covered up the reality, it wouldn't matter.

If ten survived, then we just had ten children from the start.

That would demonstrate the competence of the educational institution.

"But can education even be given to infants? They can't even understand words, right?"

"Do you know about baby signs?"

"Baby signs? What's that?"

"As you say, infants can't even speak. Baby signs are gestures designed for communication. While brain development and muscle growth are necessary for learning and handling words, hands and fingers develop much faster."

Of course, acquiring these baby signs would be difficult until about six months old.

"Ah…"

"Infants are much more intelligent than adults think. If they're not taught, all they do is cry, but if they learn baby signs, they can tell adults why they're crying. This project goes beyond that."

The ultimate form of early education. From the moment of birth, we would instill intensive education.

That was the project's purpose.
